questions.question: The term “conversion costs” refer to:
questions.option1: Manufacturing costs incurred to produce unit of output
questions.option2: All costs associated with manufacturing other than direct labour costs and raw material cost
questions.option3: Costs which are associated with marketing, shipping, warehousing, and billing activates
questions.option4: The sum of direct labour cost, direct expenses and all factory overhead costs

questions.question:
A manufacturer buys certain equipment from outside suppliers at Rs. 20 per unit. Total annual needs are 900 units. The further data are available:
Annual return of investment - 10%
Rent, Taxes, insurance per unit per year - Rs. 2
Cost of placing an order - Rs. 200
Determine the economic order quantity.
The method of costing used in a refinery is _______ costing.
Cost Unit is defined as:
questions.option1: Unit of quantity of product, service or time in relation to which costs may be ascertained or expressed
questions.option2: A location, person or an item of equipment or a group of these for which costs are ascertained and used for cost control.
questions.option3: Centres having the responsibility of generating and maximising profits
questions.option4: Centres concerned with earning an adequate return on investment

questions.question: A 10 ton truck travels between city A and B. It makes 4 round trips a day of 20 kms each. The truck is fully loaded on outward journey and returns empty. In the month of April, there are 4 Sundays on which truck doesn’t work. On 20th April, truck was off the road due to strike. Find normal effective ton-km for month of April.
A written order sent to inform the purchasing department of a need for materials is called:
